alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 6:08AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cherry, northwestern Rock, northern Brown and southwestern Keya Paha Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 608 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Norden, or 17 miles southeast of Valentine, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Springview, Norden, Wood Lake, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak, Meadville and North River Trail. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 196 and 127. Highway 20 between mile markers 212 and 227, and between mile markers 255 and 256. Highway 12 between mile markers 27 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock
